intro: Decaloba bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá decaloba, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and high-altitude grasslands. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
